Package edu.ncsu.csc216.wolf_scheduler.scheduler

Class WolfScheduler

java.lang.Object
edu.ncsu.csc216.wolf_scheduler.scheduler.WolfScheduler
public class WolfScheduler extends Object
This is the WolfScheduler class which is what allows the user to edit their schedule, from tasks like adding, removing, and getting activities.
Author:
William Krajcovic

  • Constructor Details

    • WolfScheduler

      public WolfScheduler(String fileName)
      This is the constructor that will take the file of activities and create a schedule
      Parameters:
      fileName - the name of the file that contains the list of courses that will be used to make the schedule
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the FileNotFoundException is caught

  • Method Details

    • getCourseCatalog

      public String[][] getCourseCatalog()
      This is a method that takes the courses in the catalog and puts it, the name, section and title into a 2d string array
      Returns:
      result is a 2d String array with the each row having a course and the name, section and title in the next columns

    • getScheduledActivities

      public String[][] getScheduledActivities()
      This is a method that takes the activities in the schedule and puts it, the name, section and title into a 2d string array
      Returns:
      result is a 2d String array with the each row having a course and the name, section and title in the next columns

    • getFullScheduledActivities

      public String[][] getFullScheduledActivities()
      This is a method that takes the courses in the schedule and puts the name, section, title, credits, instructorId, and meeting days into a 2d string array
      Returns:
      result is a 2d String array with the each row having a course and the name, section, title, credits, instructorId, and meetingString in the next columns

    • getScheduleTitle

      public String getScheduleTitle()
      Getter for the schedule title
      Returns:
      the title of the schedule

    • exportSchedule

      public void exportSchedule(String fileName)
      This is a method that saves the schedule to a location writing to a file
      Parameters:
      fileName - the name of the file to save the schedule to
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if FileNotFound exception is caught

    • getCourseFromCatalog

      public Course getCourseFromCatalog(String name, String section)
      This method allows the user to find a course from the catalog based if a matching name and section is found
      Parameters:
      name - the name for the course being looked for
      section - the section of the course being looked for
      Returns:
      the course with the matching name and section

    • addCourseToSchedule

      public Boolean addCourseToSchedule(String name, String section)
      This is a method that adds courses, that exist in the catalog and doesn't exist in the schedule to the schedule, it returns true if it can be added and false if it cannot be or is already in the schedule
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the course that is looking to be added
      section - the section of the course that is looking to be added
      Returns:
      returns true if the course is in the catalog and not in the schedule returns false if not in the catalog, or in the schedule
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the schedule already has the class

    • removeActivityFromSchedule

      public Boolean removeActivityFromSchedule(int idx)
      The method removes activities from the schedule if they exist, and returns true if so, and returns false if the activity does not exist
      Parameters:
      idx - TODO
      Returns:
      returns true if the activity can be removed and false if it can not

    • resetSchedule

      public void resetSchedule()
      Resets the schedule ArrayList

    • setScheduleTitle

      public void setScheduleTitle(String title)
      Sets the title for the schedule
      Parameters:
      title - the title of the wanted schedule
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the title provided is null

    • addEventToSchedule

      public void addEventToSchedule(String eventTitle, String eventMeetingDays, int eventStartTime, int eventEndTime, String eventDetails)
      Adding an event that is unique to the schedule and making sure it is not a duplicate
      Parameters:
      eventTitle - the title of the event
      eventMeetingDays - the meeting days of the event
      eventStartTime - the start time of the event
      eventEndTime - the end time of the event
      eventDetails - the details behind the event
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the event is already in the schedule
